comments:
In I20050118-1015, I cannot print a document (text file) from Eclipse.
I need to copy the contents, open a text editor, paste the contents into the
text editor and then print it.
Then it works fine.

Yes, it works. But it doesn't from a text editor within Eclipse.
Should we move it to Platform/UI?

It seems to work fine for J?r?me and Fr?d?ric using today's integration build or
I0125-0800.
So something must be wrong on my machine.

Trying to print I got this error:

org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Invalid thread access
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2839)
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2762)
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2733)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.error(Widget.java:388)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.checkWidget(Widget.java:291)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.getStyle(Widget.java:555)
        at org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.getStyle(StyledText.java:4130)
        at
org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText$Printing.initializeRenderer(StyledText.java:425)
        at org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText$Printing.run(StyledText.java:609)
        at org.eclipse.jface.text.TextViewer$5.run(TextViewer.java:3949)

J?rome and Fr?d?ric got the same error. So it definitely doesn't work for none
of us.

This exception occurs each time a file is printed. Even worse, in some case the
print job cannot be cancelled. Change severity to blocker.

It is my bug, I added it when fixing printing mirrored text.
I didn't realize the printing job run in a different thread and therefore 
can't make call to thread safe methods (in this case getStyle()).
Thanks  for the stacktrace.

Fixed in HEAD > 26012005
